Dear Kari Ann Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616- 552-3662.

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention, prohibited restraints, elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition, medical
condition, psychiatric condition, and personal history, including
any history of trauma, and must be done in a manner consistent
with the youth’s treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/26/23, youth was being moved within the facility and a group
of staff restrained the youth in the process. This resulted in an
injury to the youth's left shoulder where it popped out of socket.
Investigation This complaint was received on 10/02/2023 and investigated in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
I spoke with Director on 10/02/2023 via telephone. She said Youth
a reported to the nurse that while he was being escorted Staff
restrained him injured his shoulder. Youth A was being moved
from Pod H to Pod J due to bullying, negative behavior, and
manipulating the other youths on the pod. Youth A did assault a
staff member during the transport.
I interviewed Manger 1 at the facility on 10/03/2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Manager 1 reported Youth A
was moved from Pod H to Pod J on 09/26/2023 due to bullying
other youths. During the escort Youth A got aggressive with staff
and punched Staff 1. Youth A initially didn’t report being injured or
hurt after the transport. Youth A was examined by the nurse and
an ex-ray was done on his shoulder on 09/28/2023 after being
involved in a physical altercation with another youth.
I interviewed Complainant/Nurse on 10/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Nurse reported Youth A was examined on
09/28/2023 due to being involved in a physical altercation with
another youth. Youth A reported that his left shoulder hurt after he
was restrained on 09/26/2023 while being moved from Pod H to
Pod J. She did not observe any injuries or bruises, he had regular
range of motion, and his shoulder was not dislocated. An ex-ray
was done on Youth A’s shoulder, results revealed Youth A had
chronic abnormality which is an injury older than six months.
Youth A reported he had injured his shoulder several years prior
at a previous placement. A follow up ultrasound was ordered.
3

I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 10/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A reported he has been at the
facility for 5 months. He was on Pod H and was moved to Pod J
last week. He was involved in a fight with another youth on Pod J
last week and his arm was hurting him, so he was examined by
the Nurse. He said that staff restrained him when he was moved
from Pod H to Pod J. He admitted that he swung and punched
Staff 1 during the transport. He said Staff 1 told him “I am going to
break your arm.” He said there were several staff and security
officers that transported, but he only remembers Staff 1
threatening him. He said his shoulder hurt during the restraint and
transport, and it got worse after he got into a fight with another
youth two days later. Youth A admitted that he has an old injury
from when he was in another placement and sometimes his
shoulder hurts when agitated. Youth A reported all his needs are
being met and he did not express any concerns regarding staff or
the facility. Youth A did not want to talk about why he was moved,
and denied bullying or being bullied while he was on Pod H.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 10/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a security officer and has been
working at the facility for 5 months. He has completed all training
including Handle with Care, the facility’s restraint model. Staff 1
reported he and 3 other staff were on Pod H to assist with a
transport. He and Staff 3 approached Youth A to escort, and that’s
when Youth A started to punch him. Staff 2 and Staff 3
immediately stood between him, and Youth A. Youth A was
escalated and attempted to assault staff, so Staff 3 and Staff 2 put
Youth A in a two person hold and escorted Youth A off the Pod.
He denied threatening or using any form of force with Youth A.
Staff 1 did not assist with the transport after being assaulted by
Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 10/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a security officer and has been
working at the facility for one year. Staff 2 reported he witnessed
Youth A assaulting staff while being transported off the Pod. He
denied staff used force when transporting Youth A. He and Staff 3
did have to put Youth A in a two person hold during the escort
because he was being assaultive with staff and did not want to be
moved. Staff 2 said Youth A is very manipulative and was upset
because he was moved off the Pod. He denied hearing Staff 1
threatening Youth A. He said Youth A was the one threatening
Staff 1. He denied staff used force during the escort. He spoke
with Youth A after the transport and Youth did not complain or
report his shoulder hurt. Youth A was upset about being moved off
Pod H.
4

I interviewed Staff 3 at the facility on 10/03/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 is a security officer and was
involved in the transport of Youth A on 09/26/2023. He reported
Youth A was agitated about being moved and started to swing at
Staff 1. He and Staff 2 immediately put Youth A in a two person
hold and escorted Youth A off the pod. He said it took less two
minutes to move Youth A off the Pod. He denied staff threatened
or used force during the transport. He said Staff 1 was targeted by
Youth A, so Staff 1 did not assist with the transport. He said staff
talked and counseled Youth A about his behavior after the
transport and Youth A did not report being hurt or his shoulder
popping out of place. Staff 3 said Youth A is very manipulative and
was upset about being moved off Pod H.
I interviewed Manager 2 at the facility on 10/03/2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Manager 2 reported Youth A
had been bullying and manipulating other youths on the pod, so it
was determined that Youth A needed to be moved off the Pod. It
was a planned move and Youth A was informed that he will be
moved. He said there were three security officers and one
supervisor on the Pod. Youth A became very escalated and
assaultive when staff approached him to do the transport. Staff 2
and Staff 3 put Youth A in a two person hold to escort him off the
Pod. Manager 2 did not assist with the hold but was following staff
during the transport. He denied Staff threatened or used force
while transporting Youth A. He spoke with Youth A after the
transport and Youth A did not report being hurt or injured.
On 10/25/2023 a predisposition conference was held with MDHHS
Specialist and MDHHS Supervisor. There is no finding.
Video Reviewed:
• Video footage is from 09/26/2023 at 3:00 pm Pod H (Note:
there is no audio). Youth A was observed on the unit with
Staff 1 and Staff 3. Staff approach Youth A, and he
immediately swings and punches Staff 1 in the arm. Staff 2
and Staff 3 step in between Youth A and Staff 1. Youth A is
trying to go after Staff 1, so Staff 2 and Staff 3 put Youth A
in a two-person standing restraint for 30 seconds and then
escort him from Pod H to Pod J at 3:03 pm.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident reported dated 09/26/2023 completed by Manager
2. The incident noted resident assault staff. While on Pod H
in the dayroom, security was instructed to enter Pod H to
transport Youth A to Pod J. Youth A refused the directive of
Manager 2 to transport off the Pod. Youth A assaulted Staff
5

1 by striking him in the arm. Staff 2 and Staff 3 stepped in
between them. Youth A was escorted to Pod J by Staff 2
and Staff 3. After the incident Manager debriefed and
counseled with Youth A in his room. Youth A is scheduled
to be examined by the nurse.
• Critical and Unusual Incidents policy. The policy notes that
all employees are responsible for documenting any and all
critical/unusual incidents involving residents. The
documentation must be on the witness statements and be
completed by the end of the shift. The Facility Manager or
Supervisor must complete a summary documentation of the
incident before the end of the day. Incidents are reviewed
for accuracy by the Supervisor, then again by the Facility
Manager, and then finally by the Director.
• Handle with Care physical intervention manual for
participants.
• I reviewed the policy for Behavioral Management System,
behavioral intervention techniques, Safe Physical
Intervention, and Use of Seclusion Rooms policy. Physical
restraint touching the youth and restricting his/her
movement in any manner.
Analysis The facility is not in violation of the rule based on interviews with
staff and youth, video footage, and documentation. The restraint
used during the escort did follow the approved restraint model
policy Handle with Care. There is insufficient evidence that
Youth’s shoulder was injured as a result of the restraint.
Conclusion Violation Not Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention, prohibited restraints, elimination of restraints.
Description (1) A childcaring institution, including private secure juvenile
justice facilities, shall establish a process improvement and
restraint reduction/elimination plan that:
(a) Includes documentation of each restraint
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff did not document a restraint occurred while escorting Youth
A to another Pod.
Investigation Youth A reported on 09/26/2023 while being escorted from Pod H
to Pod J, he assaulted staff and was put in a person standing
restraint.
Video footage review shows on 09/26/2023 two staff were
attempting to escort Youth A from Pod H to Pod J. Youth A
assaults Staff 1, then Staff 2 and Supervisor stepped between
Youth A and Staff 1, and put Youth A in a two-person standing
restraint. The Staff are facing the same direction as the youth and
the staff arm is placed over the youth’s forearm and one hand is
on the youth’s back while being escorted to Pod J.
Incident reported dated 09/26/2023, written by Manager 2. The
incident noted resident assault on staff.
Analysis Based on Staff interviews and video footage review Youth A
assaulted staff while being escorted to another pod and was put in
a two-person standing restraint. An incident report was written, but
report did not note that Youth A was restrained while being
escorted. Act # 116 722.112b (h) defines “physical restraint” as
the application of physical force without the use of a device, for
the purpose of restraining the free movement of a minor child’s
body.
Technical Assistance
The facility needs to retrain staff on the difference between an
“escort” (a voluntary escort with no applied physical force by staff
or restraining the free movement of the youth) and a restraint (use
of physical force and restraining the free movement of a minor).
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000773SI intake date 09/19/2023- CAP is pending.

Rule Code & R 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (2) Health status screening of the youth will occur
immediately after seclusion or restraint by staff assigned to
this screening, as defined in agency policy. If the youth has
any physical complaints or if the screening staff has any
concerns, depending on the severity of the complaint or
concerns, the staff will arrange for the youth’s health needs
to be met immediately by any of the following actions:
(a) Consultation with the on-call or onsite nursing staff.
(b) Referral for an off-site health assessment.
(c) Contacting emergency medical services.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth did not receive medical attention until 9/29/23 as they were
being seen for an unrelated medical reason.
Investigation Manager 1 reported Youth A initially didn’t report being injured or
hurt after the transport, therefore that is why he was not examined
after the transport from Pod H to Pod J.
Nurse reported Youth A was examined on 09/28/2023 due to
being involved in a physical altercation with another youth. Youth
A reported that his left shoulder hurt after he was restrained on
09/26/2023 while being moved from Pod H to Pod J. She did not
observe any injuries or bruises, he had regular range of motion,
and his shoulder was not dislocated. An ex-ray was done on
Youth A’s shoulder, results revealed Youth A had chronic
abnormality which is an injury older than six months. Youth A
reported he had injured his shoulder several years prior at a
previous placement. A follow up ultrasound was ordered.
Youth A reported on 09/26/2023, while being escorted to another
pod he was restrained. His shoulder hurt after the restraint, but he
was not examined by the nurse until 09/28/2023.
Staff 2, Staff 3 and Manager two all reported they spoke with
Youth A following the restraint, but none of them reported they did
a health status screening and that was not indicated in the
incident report.
Documents Reviewed:
• Medical assessment dated 09/28/2023. Youth A reported
recent altercation with Staff. Youth A has history of left
shoulder pain and reported shoulder dislocation. Youth A x-
ray negative. Findings are chronic on x-ray. Left shoulder
8

demonstrates no acute fracture, no joint dislocation, normal
bony mineralization soft tissue.
Analysis The facility is in violation of the rule based on interviews with Staff
and Youth and documentations. On 09/26/2023 Youth A was
restrained during an escort, and no one completed a health status
assessment.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
